summaryText: What a powerful message from Pastor Chris Durso about surrender and being available for God's purpose! Chris walks us through the story of Mary, highlighting how a simple 14-year-old girl changed the course of human history by saying 'let it happen' to God's plan. Isn't that incredible? Sometimes we get so caught up in our own fears and limitations that we miss the amazing assignments God has for us. Pastor Chris breaks down how God wants to use EVERYONE, regardless of age, background, or perceived ability. He reminds us that we've been given gifts, but we are NOT the gift - we're simply the vessel. The most profound moment was when he explained that every spiritual gift is designed to serve OTHERS, not ourselves. Can you imagine a world where Christians understood this principle? Each of us has a unique calling, and God is just waiting for us to say 'yes' to His plan. Whether you're scared of your assignment or excited about it, the key is surrender. As Chris powerfully stated, 'It's not up to you to complete it on your own - the Holy Spirit is on you!'
mainPoints: God has a specific calling for everyone
Fear should not stop you from being faithful
Your gifts are meant to serve others, not yourself

versesMentioned.text: Six months after Elizabeth knew she was to become a mother, Gabriel was sent from God to Nazareth, a town in Galilee, to a virgin pledged to be married to a man named Joseph, a descendant of David. The virgin's name was Mary. The angel went to her and said, 'Greetings, you who are highly favored! The Lord is with you.'
Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign: The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and will call him Immanuel.
The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and they will call him Immanuel (which means 'God with us').
Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.

Now about the gifts of the Spirit, brothers and sisters, I do not want you to be uninformed. You know that when you were pagans, somehow or other you were influenced and led astray to mute idols. Therefore I want you to know that no one who is speaking by the Spirit of God says, 'Jesus be cursed,' and no one can say, 'Jesus is Lord,' except by the Holy Spirit.

Monday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Monday.focus: Understanding God's unique plan for your life
Monday.action: List three fears that have been holding you back from fully surrendering to God's plan. Pray over each one, asking God to help you overcome them.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me to trust Your plan more than my fears. Give me the courage to say 'let it happen' to Your will in my life. Remove any doubts and help me believe in Your purpose for me. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Ephesians 2:10: 'For we are God's handiwork, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.'
Tuesday.action: Ask three people who know you well what gifts they see in you. Listen without defending or explaining, just receive their observations.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, reveal the gifts You've placed in me. Help me see how I can use these gifts to serve others and bring glory to Your name. Show me practical ways to steward what You've entrusted to me. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 2:13: 'For it is God who works in you to will and to act in order to fulfill his good purpose.'
Wednesday.focus: Understanding that God equips those He calls
Wednesday.action: Make a list of skills or resources you feel you're lacking. Beside each one, write a prayer asking God to provide or develop that area in your life.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I surrender my limitations to You. Where I feel weak, be my strength. Where I feel inadequate, fill me with Your power. Help me trust that You will equip me for the assignments You've prepared. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Isaiah 6:8: 'Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, 'Whom shall I send? And who will go for us?' And I said, 'Here am I. Send me!'
Thursday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection. Ask God to show you one area of ministry or service where you can step up and say 'here I am'.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, make me willing and available. Remove any pride or fear that keeps me from serving. Help me see the opportunities You've placed before me. Give me a heart of humble obedience. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 2 Timothy 1:7: 'For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, but gives us power, love and self-discipline.'
Friday.action: Write down one thing you've been afraid to do, but know God might be calling you toward. Take one small step toward that goal today.
Friday.prayer: Holy Spirit, replace my fear with Your courage. Where I feel weak, fill me with Your strength. Help me trust that You are with me and for me. Give me boldness to step into what You've called me to do. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Psalm 32:8: 'I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.'
Saturday.action: Create a surrender journal. Write down areas of your life where you struggle to let go and trust God completely. Pray over each area.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender every area of my life to You. Where I've been holding on too tightly, help me to open my hands and trust Your plan. Teach me to say 'let it happen' in every aspect of my life. Amen.
